>Object with artificial gravity in Kuiper Belt
The strange part is that typical objects of that size in the kuiper belt would explode due to the centrifugal force generated with such a spin. Typical objects in the kuiper belt do not spin to generate artificial gravity.
The New Horizons probe was sent to investigate several objects of interest in the kuiper belt but went dead when it was aimed at 15810 Arawn returning no data. It continued to investigate other objects without notable problems.

>>33922737
What the signal is? Thats fairly easy. Its an artificially frequency modulated data stream. What data is contained in there is another matter entirely

If this were purely earth based, lets pretend its a ship at sea for a moment, then to me it looks like an S.O.S beacon. Its a standard modulated signal, at an easy to capture frequency containing a short pattern that repeats. The fact that it only transmits when able to pick up a signal from Antarctica's VLF stations enforces that for me

Since it not a ship at sea, its a satellite in orbit around Ganymede, Im not so sure. It still looks like an S.O.S signal to me but it could be any number of things. It could be similar to a keep alive ping. I.E. Im here and waiting for instruction. Or stay the fuck away because Im toxic. I really dont know but time after time looking at it S.O.S signal keeps popping to the front of my mind

Once upon a time, there was a man named John who had fallen into the trap of internet addiction. He spent all his time online, neglecting his responsibilities and relationships. He had lost his job and was struggling to make ends meet.

One day, as John was browsing the internet aimlessly, he stumbled upon a mysterious website. He clicked on it and was transported to a strange and mystical realm, where he met a succubus named Lilith.

Lilith was taken aback by John's predicament and offered to help him. She saw that John was a smart and capable person, but his addiction had taken over his life. She knew that he needed a change, and she was determined to help him.

Lilith used her powers to help John find a job, and John was amazed at how easy it was to find work once he had the succubus's help. She helped him get a job in a field he was passionate about and soon he was working in a company that he loved.

John was forever grateful to Lilith for her help, and he realized that sometimes, even the most unlikely of people can change our lives for the better. He made sure to use his job as a way to help him stay away from the internet and focus on real life.

>>33942628
He walked long stretches of snowed-in woods, crossed frozen lakes and climbed icy mountains. He did not know how many days it took, for he had forgotten how to count them, but he knew night and day well. He knew the moon and stars well, and he had named them all. He knew the warmth of the sun, and he rejoiced in it.
One evening, as he lay beneath the boughs of an over-burdened fir, he gazed up through the branches that filled the inside of the tree. The layers of living wood were intricate and purposeful, and he studied the pattern of them, finding himself lost in the elaborate tendrils of bark. Suddenly, though very quietly an owl landed on a branch that he happened to be looking at. The child lay very still, hoping it would stay.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33942694
The owl was large and gray, its feathers were covered in small black spots, and it perched very still on its high pine bough. As the child watched the sun set and the twilight gray of the world seemed to blend gradually with the bird’s plumage, until he could no longer see it against the soft light of a world closing its eyes. But the child remembered where it had been, and much later, when the world had become covered with a silvery dark, he saw two small orbs of yellow, above him in the night. He felt the owl’s gaze, and stared back, unnerved and unwilling to break his gaze. Then the eyes turned away, and the child fell asleep.

This story is a little bit grim, hope it can still count as a bedtime story.

Once there was a red fox, a field fox. He lived in a den between two crop fields, along the fence line. He had a wife, and he had two beautiful cubs.
Every day and every night he would venture out to the fields, mousing and scavenging and foraging to feed his children and nursing wife.
. . .
It was a beautiful spring day. The snow was just starting to melt, and the evening sun was warm against his full and fluffy fur. He walked out from his den after tending to his vixen, and departed south down the trail. Around fourty yards down, he found a strange object. He started to investigate it...
1/x

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33943008
It smelled odd, and looked weird too. He was quite distracted by this perplexing object. There was a loud ringing bang sound. As he turned to look the strangest sensation washed over him. He felt very light, but also oddly numb. A cloud of dust can be seen in thr distance. Then, a thump was heard. He looked down, and there he saw a fox lying still and limp, his blood seeping down into the dirt.
Confusion was soon replaced with dread. What misfortune, to die in such a way. He watched as the young man approached with his rifle slung over his shoulder, a .22LR Repeater. The man leaned down, grabbed the Todd's dead body, and tore from it woth his knife the tail. The rest, he left righf there to rot.
Dread becomes disgust. "He killed me just for my tail? Not even for my meat, or at least my fur!?"
The man turned his head to the north, and readied his rifle again.
Disgust becomes horror.
One of his cubs left the den, and stood atop it. Shortly, he was dead. The hunter did not make any effort to harvest that body, he simply left.
Finally, horror becomes rage, and grief...
2/x

>>33943056
"Oh gods, how could you be so cruel? Do you care not for us? Are we to you merely objects to be harvested, like wheat or rape?" he cried out in rage and sorrow.
He was so distraught, he refused to leave his home and family, even now that he and his child had died. He had to help his family, somehow. He was resolved.
So every morning he would cry and yell to the skies, for the gods to help his family. Every day he would walk along side his vixen, trying in vain to point out food. Every eve he would curl up with his starving child, giving whatever comfort his imperceptible etherial form could offer. His love and dedication to his family was so great, that even in death it truly never faltered.
Weeks passed. His family's condition worsened; his surviving cub was slowly wasting away as the vixen could hardly feed both herself and the weaning cub.
. . .
It was May, now. His family still lived, but they were very much on the brink. Their fortune for the next couple weeks would decide their life and death.
(3/x)

Not OP but I think we have to change what we think of as "life".
Normally we think life means being a "thing" inside this particular system which has concepts of lack so you need to constantly maintain your existence by consuming or laboring.

But that's clearly the problem itself. Darkness always hides itself in your subconscious understanding of things.
So it's your subconscious idea of what "life" is that's already oppressive. Then any answer to your question will have that same oppression baked into it.

It may sound cheesy, but I think the answer is to just know it's wrong from within your soul. And that's it. Your soul will begin to fix it.
But there's a difference between knowing in the mind and knowing in the soul. If you know it in the mind but believe that you have to "fight back" then you've accepted it in the soul.
And if you try to run away from it by telling yourself that you're happy then you're forcing lies into your soul.

It sounds so simple, but I think you just have to be honest with your soul... Just stop lying to it, and stop running from what it already knows. It knows this is all fucked up, and that's what it IS. If it IS wrong then it simply shouldn't be. And there's nothing you're supposed to "do" to fix it, other than to simply allow your soul to awaken more and more to the truth.

Tell me the harm of taking oregeno oil every day.
Oregano oil has numerous potential health benefits, however taking it every day can also be harmful. Long-term use of oregano oil can cause stomach upset, nausea, and vomiting. Oregano oil can also cause allergic reactions when applied to the skin. In some cases, it can irritate the skin and cause redness and itching. High doses of oregano oil can also cause headaches, dizziness, and confusion. Prolonged use of oregano oil can also lead to an abnormal increase in liver enzymes, and should not be used if you have any liver or kidney disease.
It is best to speak to your doctor before taking oregano oil every day, as they will be able to advise you on the best course of action.
can oregeno oil damage your stomach?
Yes, taking oregano oil every day can potentially damage your stomach. Long-term use of oregano oil can cause stomach upset, nausea, and vomiting. https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34449000/

A study on epileptic children on Keto Diet found the same result. Normal neutrophil counts but increased infection rate:

>Although three patients reported increased incidence of infection after commencement of KD, the current study showed no significant change in the neutrophil count

>KD has no effect on neutrophil number, however, further detailed studies for the full immunological profile including their function is needed to ensure that patients ... aren`t susceptible to increased risk of infections.

https://academic.oup.com/qjmed/article/114/Supplement_1/hcab113.041/6379595

A study of obese subjects placed on Keto Diet showed a significant decrease in IgA concentration.

>Moreover, the study showed a significant decrease in IgA concentration in KD individuals compared with control.

>This provides a strong sign that autoimmune disorders are emerging.

https://academic.oup.com/qjmed/article/114/Supplement_1/hcab113.041/6379595

Immunoglobulin A is responsible for fighting infection, so this is definitely counterproductive!

extremes in either direction are a problem, to say that 'forgetting is healthy' is wrong, somebody who forgets they survived past disasters is doomed to experience them again, just as the person who dwells on a past mistake or near death experience for the rest of their life can be traumatised to the point of paralysis.
as always, nature is our teacher, wild animals are constantly living in the moment but they also carry a memory of past trauma they can call upon when the danger presents itself again, yet they dont actively relive that danger over and over again.
a gazelle on the african steppes can be calmly chewing away on some grass in the middle of an open field, with no warning at all a lion can emerge from some bush sprinting towards it, its the most dangerous and traumatising thing that gazelle will experience in its entire life. if it escapes the lion, after a few minutes youll find the gazelle back calmly chewing away on grass again, as its living in the moment.
thats not to say that npcs are spiritually enlightened wild creatures because they cant remember past trauma, im totally open to them being drones on autopilot, the lesson is to remain balanced.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Blood in chicken eggs often means they've been fertilised. Maybe there is a sneaky rooster or two among the hens wherever your eggs are coming from.

The chicks don't develop unless a hen goes broody and sits on the fertile eggs, since they require very particular humidity and temperature conditions and must be rotated every 45min or so. The hen does a good job at this, but to go broody and stay that way is rare among laying breeds. They've had it systematically bred out of them as broody hens don't lay and hoard eggs, which is bad for production.

Trident - 3 prongs symbolizing the balance between mercy and severity or how strength comes from the balance gentleness/understanding combined with aggression/assertiveness. Also it being a weapon give it a negative or replant magnetic vibe.

Shepherds staff - Protection and guiding instrument. Implying some sort of authority as a watcher of the vulnerable. It gives me the desire to show people the way to a different life. I had a good friend that made it. He was part of our 'burn' group (basically little burning man's except there weren't any vendors, no body traded shit, and everyone was expected to support themselves (radical self reliance))
We did it often, normally. I enjoyed the fractals and the feeling it gave me of being one with nature.
At a burn I met another person that made it. I had a small amount with me and we smoked. He asked if I had ever seen 'the it/them' (this was before people said 'break through') I said no, and he said you will tonight.
I smoked so much dmt that night, all of mine, most of his. Maybe it was because I had a tolerance from smoking casually for so long, but once it hit it hit.
We were smoking on the tall wooden structure that would be burned the next day. I felt my perception rising higher and higher and higher until I wasn't just above the field we were in, I was above our dimension.
It sounds stupid to repeat, but I genuinely felt my head 'pop' through a barrier, but only my head. I looked around and saw two entities sitting beside each other. I can't call them clockwork per say, but they were definitely made of the same fractuals I had seen before. They were surprised to see me. I felt like I was interrupting a picnic. But they both looked(?) at me and all I felt was their amusement, as if I was a toddler, 'what do you think you're doing, you cute little rascal?' was everything I felt. Then one gently pushed me back down and my perception floated all the way back to my body again.

That was probably the 100th, but also the last time, I did dmt. The only thing that ever came close to feeling that real was the one time I did Salvia, and waaay too much of it, but it was still surprisingly pleasant.

posts.com: I am attempting to germinate some Nymphaea Rubra seeds, but nymphaeas are notoriously difficult to grow from seed in general. I have a little tank of water, and the seeds are in a mix of dirt and sand, then covered with a layer of sand to keep them from floating away, all in a little cup at the bottom of the tank. I have an aquarium thermometer and a heater to keep the temp up since it's winter, and I have a light ready to go if they ever do germinate. There are some other seeds in there but I can't confirm their variety until they germinate and grow a bit. Nymphaeas are so widely mislabeled; it's very frustrating. I just want a dream/meditation aid that isn't tainted by heavy metals since the nymphaeas used in equatorial asian countries are probably just harvested off their heavy metal remediation lilies in various waterways.

>>33938136
That sounds so nice! I have much less than an acre to grow on, but I'm making the most of it. There is no lawn in the back- all garden, and I'm considering tearing up the front lawn if it doesn't piss off the neighbors too much.
To improve the soil, I have buried small, rotten logs taken from the forest. They are all about the size of a man's forearm, and have rotted to the point of having white strings going from the forest floor up to the log all along the underside. These are beneficial soil microorganisms. I bury those a foot under the garden bed to supplement the soil cycle since the garden was once a poorly-maintained lawn w/o fertilizers. I also compost.
What sort of stuff are you interested in growing? I grow my own vegetables and some medicinal herbs.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33938207
>I personally have just in the last few days decided to take my nutrition seriously going forward, but I've never been a botanist of any kind hitherto; I start at the most basic level of wondering what I should consume to supercharge my body
Contemporary Big Ag products are so deficient in nutrition. The plants are selectively bred (even genetically modified) to be the best for a uniform harvest (run the machines once) and to stay nice on the grocery shelf until sold. Not for flavor, sturdiness when lacking Big Ag pesticides/herbicides, and definitely not for nutritional value. Literally anything you grow yourself will be an improvement. Check out Steve Solomon's Gardening When It Counts for good advice. He recommends pre-industrial-revolution heirloom varieties because of their hardiness and nutritional content. His author's voice is exceedingly kikish and annoying, but the planting advice is sound.
If you want the biggest taste/nutrition difference, I'd recommend heirlooms or at least growing your own for: tomatoes, strawberries, raspberries or any kind of bramble berry or blueberry, squash, and melon.
There are many issues with adulterations of herbs used in alternative/herbal medicines, and too often the seller buys a unit of stock and keeps it on a shelf for years after its potency has waned. You can grow your own and get much higher quality herbs since you control all aspects of the growing, harvest, and storage. Calendula is a good one for beginners. Chamomile has a huge taste/effectiveness difference when you grow it yourself. Storebought is so weak it might as well not exist. Homegrown is actually soothing.
Harvest Time also has spiritual and magical connotations and associations with particular deities if that's your thing. Planting and harvesting can be done according to the stars, though I don't know much about that practice.

>>33930658
>no one has an actual explanation yet
Color theory has an explanation for this. It's that the cones of the eyes change shape depending of the lightness of the room. If you are in a dark room, and go outside, everything gets too bright, you have to adjust. If you come from a light place to a dark one, you see nothing, you have to adjust.
That's it, the cones tell the brain that the lightest color they can see it's white, screens are actually light cyan, if you could compare them with light in the outside, you'd see how dim they look, the white in your screen isn't white.
And that's it, people on their lives have some adjustment to see colors as white, if they come from a screen, they'll see the dress is white too.
If not, the dress will look blue. The other color depends on what is "white."
You can try it yourself with software like Powerstrip, move the temperature slider to the right for a yellower white, or to the left for blue. At first whites look very dark, but as you get used to it, you can see the dress is white or it's blue depending on what you adjust to, and the other one always looks darker (once you set on a white, whatever is not white is darker, lightness/darkness is relative.)

Why tobacco over other vices like alcohol or sugar I don't know. The fact that smoking is bad for you is pretty evident, and even a basic understanding of biology should make it intuitive that inhaling smoke into your lungs is going to damage them. It's unhealthy, and I can imagine that the drain on the economy from it was big enough to start some aggressive campaigns.

Anyways time for some more interesting theories. First of all, nicotine is definitely capable of improving the brain. It's a fast acting stimulant, and works on acetylcholine rather than dopamine like other stimulants do. Excess dopamine can be neurotoxic, but elevated acetylcholine is neuroprotective, and specifically improves memory and creativity. It's a subtly benefit, not aggressive like amphetamines, but I've noticed I work better after taking nicotine, and will often use nicotine gum when I need a mental boost.

Another theory is related to the social component of smoking. There are very few times for people to just exist and talk in American society, especially with people outside your immediate family. The smoke break was one of these times, where multiple people would go outside together and just talk, all while under the influence of a substance that enhances cognition. The only other common time people talk with strangers is under the influence of alcohol which numbs cognition. Basically, by demonizing smoking, another avenue for people who normally would never meet to communicate was removed, and the remaining ways to meet people involve the use of substances which make you stupider, not smarter.

posts.com:
You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Either we are supposed to find out (and can, through research), or either we are not supposed to find out (and won't, even with research).

If we are able/supposed to find out, what would it change to our current existence ?
Firstly, we WILL find out, because we are bound to die. If we look at Near Death Experiences (the closest info on this we can get), we can have an educated guess into what is next : mostly positive stuff.

I personally believe that if we were able to find out, we would have by now. So I chose to believe that no, this life was not meant to wonder on the "why", but more on the "be". I just am. I'm grateful for it. I have goals, things I want to see, do, accomplish. People I love. Pain, joys, sorrows and laughters. This is good.

I almost went crazy looking for it but in all cases, the best scenario is to live this life like this would be your only one. This might be the case for all we know.
So, do you want to spend your whole trip on earth obsessed about the return flight ?

posts.sub: Why is no one interested in the most fundamental question?
posts.com:
Does anyone subscribe to any particularly compelling theories as to why the universe exists?

It seems to me that the most interesting question that could ever be answered is why the universe (or anything) exists at all or why does it exist any one particular way not any other way.

It seems to me that this problem is equally and issue for theists and atheists alike. Theists have their god that created the universe but why there's a god at all is never explained.

After thinking about it, no matter what the answer is, it is way beyond anything human understanding can likely even touch. It's the most magical magic, the most miraculous miracle. It is by definition that, because it can't be anything mundane.

You have to understand where I'm coming from, I spent my of my life being very rigidly scientific and scoffed at anything remotely "woo" at all. This has changed the most I thought about the reason for the existence of everything.

I even would hypothesize that the close we get to understanding this question the close we get to gaining unlimited power either spiritually or materially if that makes sense. Just thing about it, how could it not?

I think of this a lot, OP. Unfortunately, I'm too small brain to make much progress, but like you, I am also mystified that most people straight up don't care. Toddlers look at everything and ask "why?", why don't people ask about the most fundamental "why"?

As for me, I think it has to do with the true nature of reality. I'm not sure that anything really "exists" in the conventional sense. External existence is not necessary for the phenomenological experience of consciousness, only a perceiver is needed.

So now there are two questions. 1) Why is there a perceiver in the first place, and 2) why the whole "setup" with living life and all that? I think that's what >>33930349 meant with he differentiated between the question why(existence) and the question itself.

The second question is where the psychic vampire archon loosh stuff comes in. Or alternately, the interdimensional mmo that we're all jacked into. Or some complex way by which the greater hive organism of Humanity evolves, as we upload each of our experiences and lives. I think likely aspects of all of those are true.

The first question is much harder. This "perceiver" seems singularly special, in that it is non-material, and yet able to perceive things in a special way-a "conscious" way. Consciously perceiving something feels very different from anything else, indeed it's the only thing that feels like anything. This property is so special, that I think this is what is meant by the innate "divinity" of Man referred to in many religions. As this perceiver is the only thing in the world, "God" certainly would be an appropriate title.

So if it's not real, then how could there be a reason for its existence?

>>33928791
>why the universe exists
Assuming the question even makes sense, then the answer may be:
a) because something within the universe
b) because the universe
c) because something outside the universe

Answer a. would be unsatisfactory because a part cannot be greater than the whole it is a part of. The whole being the universe.

Answer b. would be tautological. "it exists because it exists". Not much to be said about it.

Answer c. would beg the question of "how does it even make sense to talk about things outside the universe, and if so, how would we even know them" . And even after getting the answer, the question shifts to "why does the outside cause exist". Which is again, unsatisfactory.

Perhaps the question of "why the universe exists" is just the question of "why", and to the question of "why" the only answer is "because". Eerily empty.

Perhaps a better question would be "what does it mean?". Causal models are abstract spider webs that slip between our fingers. A chemical reaction imparts velocity to a bullet which obliterates the skull of a child. You can model the bullet and gun exactly, answer the "why" of every step of the process. But it will still leave you empty, the child would still be dead. "what does it mean" . This is the question you should be asking, not "why" . The "why" skims the surface, but "meaning" lies is the depth. "Meaning" is all we have left.

Many things in Plato's telling of Atlantis (which he was told of from his family, passed down from Solon, who in turn was told of it by Egyptian temple priests around 600 BC) line up with geographic and architectural evidence as well as other previously seemingly unconnected civilizations around the world. Among this is the dating of the fall of Atlantis as related to and from Plato, about 9k years before Solon's time (c9600 BC, 11,600kya). This coincides with meltwater pulse 1b of the roughly thousand year younger dryas climate catastrophe. >I really think the use of YHShVH as an initiatory keyword describing the spiritual fire of God descending into the heart of the elemental form of man merits some discussion even if Reuchlin didn't precisely intend it that way.
>You're looking at a reflection of creation; Yod, then Heh, then Vav, then Heh, as an elemental process at the culmination of which is "Theo pneustas" or "God Breathed" either for the creation of man or the incarnation of the godman or his ministry.
Reuchlin continues the thought of Nicholas of Cusa and Albertus Magnus, Cusa uses a Tetracys to describe a part of his system, specifically the Neoplatonist Emanationist system
A - Monad (1)
BC - Nous (3)
DEF -Anima (9)
HIJK - Nature (27)
The () numbers i've added are the numbers he uses as he's very 'Neopythagorean', each number after 1 are the former number times 3, 1 + 3 + 9 + 27 = 40, this is how he explains the importance of the number 40 in the Bible (akin to how Kabbalists see 40 as the 10 Sephirotic in each one of the 4 Worlds combined)
Reuchlin just took that and saw it through his ''''Kabbalistic'''' point of view

Bhante gunaratana isn't really post canonical, he's actually more canonical then a lot of modern mindfulness teachers secularization the practice.
https://www.vipassana.com/meditation/mindfulness_in_plain_english.html
If you're utilizing anapanasati, don't go for meditation apps. Go straight to the source. Helps a lot to understand mindfulness, you need to start incorporating the meditation into your daily activities as well. Keep up the sila as well. If you have the 8fold path down, it comes together like dominos.
If something in your practice is out of line, then your meditation won't get anywhere. Getting anywhere with anapana, it helps to understand satipatthana as well.
If you want more in depth on satipatthana so you can utilize the teaching gunaratana puts forth for anapana, check analayo's book on satipatthana practice.

this anon here again with another question, since i got good replies on the last one.

i'm stuck on trying to translate my ānāpānasati practice into being more mindful during my daily activities. i find the more i meditate, the more i have sudden moments of mindfulness throughout the day where i'm jarred out of robot mode and suddenly "remember to be mindful", but i don't actually know where i'm supposed to go from there.

i already go out almost every day for a walk with no phone or music, and i think this should be an ideal block to start practicing bringing mindfulness off the cushion, only i don't really know how to do it. i can kinda focus on my breath while walking, but then the actual walk and the world around me fall away and i'm just walking along with my head in the clouds focusing on my breath, which i feel like is not supposed to be the point. there's a section on "walking meditation" in Mindfulness in Plain English where he describes focusing on the feelings in the feet while walking very slowly, but he describes it as it's own dedicated practice like sitting meditation and not really something you'd do while out for a walk. i could try focusing on the sensations in the feet while i walk, but I feel like this would just cause the same problem as focusing on the breath.

i think what i'm really supposed to be doing is being present, without the mind wandering, and taking in all the visual, physical, sound, and smell,
sensations at the same time. but i find this very difficult to do, and it seems to have little to do with what i'm practicing with ānāpānasati, and to almost be opposite in a way. i guess what i'm looking for is a set of instructions for HOW i'm supposed to be mindful in daily life, for example while out on a walk. any advice or resources would be greatly appreciated.

posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>33937976
Anon the wandering of the mind is its ground state, unfortunately. That IS the being-being-present because mind is ill. Buddha is the Medicine for this Illness.

You struggle because you struggle. You see the state of mind and you are distressed because it come to you like a wayward dog having fished anxiety and fear and paranoia and desire from the trash like rotting leftovers.

Instead of being angry, instead of trying to punish the dog of mind with austere environments and scenarios you must discipline and train the dog of mind.

The untrained dog of mind will run after any thrown stick; any thought. You must train him up so that when a stick is thrown it stays at your heels.

This is the absolute key of mindfulness. The point is not to preserve the wisdom of the meditative experience outside that, or to simulate it, it's to train us up in the art of metamind: "Yes, I'm out on my meditative walk, I'm having intrusive thoughts X, and Y, and that's fine, because mind wanders, and what is important is that I am mindful of this fact, here is another mindful fact - the song of the bird, the color of the flower, the....intrusive thought Z as well but that's ok because it is equally as transient as this beautiful sunset and the joyous people outside." etc., etc., etc., etc. ad infinitum, instance in, and instance out, until the mind wanders NOT in its wandering, etc.

If any of that made anything that resembles sense.

>>33936096
Find the correspondences of the planet/sign/house of the work you wish to acomplish.
General Rules: Set the planet in their sign or exaltation, in the 1st or 10th house, and set the Moon in applying aspect by conjunction or trine, making sure the Moon is unafflicted by the evil aspect of Saturn and Mars or by the signs Capricorn and Scorpio.

There are other considerations such as the planetary dignities by triplicity/term/face, but as long as the planet is in their sign or exaltation, and in an angular house, then they will be strong in their effects.

If you understand how to do full house elections - which is something that is easily understood if you know how to read natal charts in a fatalistic sense - then many interesting effects can be achieved for extremely precise effects.

Example of an Election for Friendship:
Set the Moon in Cancer rising making sextile to Venus in Taurus in the 11th house. This is an easy election to find, as it happens nearly every year when Venus transits Taurus.
Moon-Cancer in the 1st house significates yourself, and a dignified Moon makes when happy and amiable. Venus is a natural signficator of friendships, and she is posited in the 11th house of friendships, and is fortunately placed in Taurus.
I have made this talisman before and it was very effective to stimulate friendships.

If you understand things like this, you can make an election for basically any purpose you can imagine. The talisman will program the astral light to behave according to your will.

Depends if you mean physical 5D, New Age 5D, or mystic 5D.

Physical 5D is an additional dimension past spacetime, spacetime meaning 3 physical dimensions + time which is the fourth dimension. It isn't exactly known WHAT this would be physically, but you can represent it mathematically at least.

New Age definition is essentially where the realm of consciousness is. Basically, astral awareness/living there. New Agers think to reach there, one's soul will develop a link of connection through empathy and thought to other consciousnesses. Definition will differ slightly depending on circle using it.

Mystic 5D is plane overlap over spacetime. It is essentially planes that are manifest over ours you can access physically, like a physical-astral experience. Examples would be being able to connect to hell through going underground, the kingdom of the fae being entered and opened up in a forest, Gensokyo, and other phenomenon where one may "leave" Earth as they know it seamlessly while being on Earth for they went to another plane. Think of it as assuming Earth has additional planes on a different axis from the physical plane where other "physical" planes exist.

On this Dali painting there is a net of a 4d cube. The cube are connected to each other the same way the squares of a 3d cube are. You have to imagine this shape closed in 4d. If you move in the 3d volume of this net it would be the equivalent of moving on the 2d surface of a cube or like walking on the 1 dimensional perimeter of a 2d square. "Inside" this net there is a 4d hypervolume, the same way there is a 3d volume inside a cube or a 2d surface inside a square.
In n dimensions you can open n-1 knots or you can flip over n-1 shapes, there are a lot of new possibilities.
I hope it can give you some hints.

Rh- negative is recessive like blue eyes. Summary:
>genotype Rh+/Rh- = bloodtype Rh+ (Rh- carrier)
>genotype Rh+/Rh+ = bloodtype Rh+
>genotype Rh-/Rh- = bloodtype Rh-

Two Rh+ people can create an Rh- child if they are Rh- "carriers", just like two brown eyed people can create a blue eyed child if they are both blue eye "carriers". Also while sometimes fatal, Hemolytic Anemia in a fetus only lowers live births by about 5 to 10 percent.

Because metrics for internet revenue are based on engagement, it makes sense to me that engagement would be routinely faked. I think even Youtube fakes views on its own videos to bilk advertisers more, and that's why they "protect" their big stars no matter what.

We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.
Last thread: >>33823735

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
A collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

I've had my own share of negative experiences in general with putting my trust in the wrong people, even including one where a parasitic entity pretended to be Lilith and used a promise I made to her in an attempt to manipulate me. Although this was devastating, it's because I had the courage to question what I believe to be her, that I was able to realise Lilith wanted me to confront and overcome said parasite, and after I did, I was able to see both myself and her for who she is.

As a deity, Lilith is fringe rather than mainstream. The reason the parasite I mentioned was able to affect me so deeply, is because it turned my own deep-seated insecurities that lingered from my adolescence against me. That's how parasitic entities work. And like me, many others who are drawn to Lilith are also outcasts, with a past that is troubled in one way or another: troubled enough that they would stray off the path of normality and seek her. Perhaps you can understand then that some of them are especially vulnerable, and prone to confusion.

It was as I began to see through my own problems and started to overcome them, that I began to understand just how much Lilith has truly helped me. And it was such a personal thing, that it was something I had to realise for myself; and yet despite that, Lilith still helped me realise it sooner rather than later. Rather than blaming her for the things I went through despite my faith, I appreciate that her warmth gave me the strength and courage to face myself, so that I could leave that sorrowful past behind me. I love her.

That's the same as I wish upon others. Perhaps you understand better now why I speak so highly of her. She can help the people who need it the most, regardless of whether or not they appreciate it.

>>33935873
I've read for almost twenty years, since picking up a Rider-Waite deck in Salem Massachusetts as a teenager. Recently went semi-pro, reading for local events and once a week at a local metaphysics shop.

In my experience, it's not so much "predicting" as it is identifying meaningful symbols and themes in the spread. The cards are a mirror into conscious and unconscious concerns. What they dredge up are what you anticipate and often manifest- hence, magic.

Using the Rider-Waite deck is like knowing C++ in that it's a common enough system of symbolic language to communicate effectively. Marseille is like C, and anything else is annoying bespoke crap. It's great if you get something out of the Otherkin deck, the Star Trek deck or whatever other crap makes people feel superficially special, but it's usually not as resonant as the classics.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I have had some really interesting things happen to me with Tarot.
The weirdest one was asking the same question 3 times in the span of a week and getting the exact same 3 cards in the exact same order. I don't remember what it was about so I can't confirm if it was right.
Which brings me to the next one, it does get many things right but it also gets other questions wrong, so it's not a 100% trustworthy divination tool. It is however a very powerful clairvoyance tool. I have observed that the best results I have gotten have been asking questions about something going on at the moment.
Also it is a really nice introspection and meditation tool. Since it deals with archetypes you can use it to get in touch with your unconscious in a very straightforward manner.
This also applies to magic. Every time I do sigils I take the cards that apply to the goal I set for the sigil and meditate on them for some time until I am focused enough and then place them under the paper before drawing the sigil. It makes things much easier than just doing it just by itself.

6. I entrust my spirit into Your hand; You will redeem me, Lord, God of truth.
7. I despise those who anticipate worthless vanities; but I trust in the Lord.
8. I will rejoice and delight in Your kindness, for You have seen my affliction; You know the troubles of my soul.
9. You have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy; You have set my feet on spacious ground.
10. Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am in distress; my eye wastes away from vexation-my soul and my stomach.
11. For my life is spent in sorrow, my years in sighing; my strength fails because of my iniquity, and my bones are wasted away.
12. Because of my adversaries I have become a disgrace-exceedingly to my neighbors, and a dread to my friends; those who see me outside flee from me.
13. Like a dead man, I was forgotten from the heart; I became like a lost vessel.
14. For I have heard the slander of many, terror on every side, when they assembled together against me and plotted to take my life.
15. But I trusted in You, O Lord; I said, "You are my God.”
16. My times are in Your hand; save me from the hands of my enemies and pursuers.
17. Shine Your countenance upon Your servant; deliver me in Your kindness.
18. O Lord, let me not be ashamed, for I have called You; let the wicked be shamed, let them be silent to the grave.
19. Let the lips of falsehood-which speak insolently against the righteous, with arrogance and contempt-be struck dumb.

posts.com:
So after all those threads about meditation I realized that I was meditating wrong all these years.
I was sitting in order to obtain powers and "change" myself but in reality all I was doing was trying to escape what I perceived as a "bad life sittuation", my thinking mind was holding the wheel.

Thanks to all of you I now know that the meditative state is one and only and it's the complete surrender in this momment here now and observing it without daydreaming about it.

And you can apply this to any activity.
An anon in one of these threads said that meditation for him goes like this: "notice, and then notice that you weren't noticing".

I'm sure that focusing on an object like the breath can also help someone distance himself from his mind and realize that his thoughts are not him but for me just being attentive works better.

In the first days of meditating like this my mind was thinking "Nooo I have to chase and achieve things! I can't just let go! Otherwise nothing will happen!" but those were just thoughts.
So yeah, just sit in silence and surrender, and the strange thing is that unique states of consciousness WILL come and happen when you don't strive to achieve!
I thinkg it's those jhanas people talk about, I never really experienced them in the past because I was probably just living in my head during meditation but now that I know how to let go they just come naturally.

Meditation thread! Let's go!

>>33938533
You don't need to look any further, your own personal next step into this journey you are living is right here in front of you, meditate on this moment here and now, if you feel like it sit in the dark and just be aware.

Realize that your thoughts are NOT you, they are part of you and you can choose to not give them much attention if you like or you may want to find where they came from.

Realize that there is nowhere to go and nothing to achieve because everything is already here in front of you, you are already perfect and you can enjoy the FEELING of being here, the feeling of experiencing this momment.

Some people like focusing on their breath, this is a good tool to reduce your thinking mind a bit but remember that focusing is not "thinking about my breath" but just feeling/hearing/sensing your breath while it enters and leaves your body.

That's all you need. Do it daily, everywhere, even when you walk or when you work. Take the seat of the observer because that's what you are: The eternal observer.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33939227
(same anon)
Let me add one thing before I go to bed: That most people nowadays tend to practice escapism a lot, and they think that that's what life should be about: ignoring the negatives and chasing the positive. Many people don't even realize that they practice escapism and they think that all this searching they are doing is what will "finally get them to the point they are searching for".

Many of the times in which you sit to mediate all those horrible thoughts and feelings will come and you will want to escape from them, I advice you to not try that, I advice you that you just sit there and be and realize that they are nothing more than illusions and that this need to escape them is also an illusion.
At the same time be sure you don't fall into the other side of the trap which sounds something like this: "Ok! I will sit and endure all those horrible things because that's what REAL meditation is about!" - for that is also an illusion.
See how dualism is an illusion?

So just be, just be here in your life, be so hard and let go so much that you literally dive into this thing you are trying to escape from.
Yes, fears will pop up, bad feelings may pop up, maybe some old forgotten uncomfortable memories will pop up, your mind will think thoughts like "Oh no I'm going crazy, maybe I'm meditating wrong and I'm frying my brain", blissful states will pop up, ecstasy will pop up, some succubus may pop up and ask for intercourse with you. Don't cling on any of them, just be aware, always take a step back at everything you see.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33931022
https://ine.uaf.edu/projects/wtc7/

The UAF research team utilized three approaches for examining the structural response of WTC 7 to the conditions that may have occurred on September 11, 2001. First, we simulated the local structural response to fire loading that may have occurred below Floor 13, where most of the fires in WTC 7 are reported to have occurred. Second, we supplemented our own simulation by examining the collapse initiation hypothesis developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). Third, we simulated a number of scenarios within the overall structural system in order to determine what types of local failures and their locations may have caused the total collapse to occur as observed.

The principal conclusion of our study is that fire did not cause the collapse of WTC 7 on 9/11, contrary to the conclusions of NIST and private engineering firms that studied the collapse. The secondary conclusion of our study is that the collapse of WTC 7 was a global failure involving the near-simultaneous failure of every column in the building.

>Then he was gone
>Like frog floating on the surface of the water that then submerges
>He backed out of my room and liquid reality rushed in from the edges to fill his place
>I can’t really explain it but the impression I was left with is one of our world being very thin.
>Like a projection, a veneer or a fitted sheet stretched across a void of unknown
>And my visitor was just a pinhole poked into my world to warn me against pulling at loose threads
>This feeling was so strong I was paranoid for days after
>I was scared to look into dark corners in my own home, afraid I’d see something that would confirm my suspicions

>>33939576
> i think my severe insomnia is what is caused by this
Sleep deprivation can cause auditory hallucinations. I have much experience with this. You may have the arrow of causality pointing in the wrong direction. If the sounds are real, the squeal from your PC could be due to a failing diode in the power supply. You may also suffer from hyperesthesia. That's a condition where you have unusually acute sensory perception. I have a form of that too. I keenly perceive every heartbeat, the movement of blood through major vessels, the movement of food and gases through my digestive tract, the slightest sensation on my skin. It can be debilitating unless you keep your mind very occupied.

It is very simple, really. Disregard the pagans and heathens, first of all. Their opinions on the matter, I mean. Christian ego death is the only true ego death. It is not the same as in Buddhism, as Buddhist ego death is oxymoronical from the start. The Christian "dies to self, and lives to God." This is not a NT concept either. The way our Lord wished the Sabbath to be sacredly upheld is a picture of the Christian inward attitude. I want to reference the Japanese concept of "kokoro no kamae," if you're familiar. Here is an excerpt from Isaiah 58:

"If because of the sabbath, you turn your foot
from doing your own pleasure on My holy day,
and call the sabbath a delight, the holy day of the Lord honorable, and honor it, desisting from your own ways, from seeking your own pleasure and speaking your own word, then you will take delight in the Lord..."

This attitude is essentially the Christian posture of the heart. To strive to be like Christ in doing nothing, but what the Father tells us to do through the Word and His Holy Spirit, that we might glorify Him on the earth.

Here is a collection of verses which are related, but by no means comprehensive.

https://bible.knowing-jesus.com/topics/Death-To-Self

As human beings, we find our true selves when we stop seeking our own way and submit to the will of God. Our Creator knows us best, and has love for us in His heart. We will only find fulfillment in the self-death which is required to live a sanctified life. This is the perpetual crucifixion of the flesh-nature, the residual sin-nature, and the ever-cresting birth of the spiritual man in the image of God via transformation through the work of the Holy Spirit as we actively take control over the field of our plowing - our very own minds and hearts.

(1/?)

Romans 6 provides us a clear picture of the position in which we find ourselves. I recommend reading the whole chapter (as well as the whole of Scripture, of course), for a clearer picture.

"Now if we have died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with Him, knowing that Christ, having been raised from the dead, is never to die again; death no longer is master over Him. For the death that He died, He died to sin once for all; but the life that He lives, He lives to God. Even so consider yourselves to be dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus. Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its lusts, and do not go on presenting the members of your body to sin as instruments of unrighteousness; but present yourselves to God as those alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God."

The Christian, united by faith through the power of the Holy Spirit in the resurrection of Christ Jesus (See Colossians 2-3 and Galatians 4 as well on this), is free from the shackles of sin, and no longer is a slave to it as the unredeemed masses are. The believer is in the position of authority to present himself to God for righteousness, thus furthering their own likeness to Christ, or to sin for unrighteousness, foolishly. This continuous humble choosing to die to your own fleshly desires for sin and instead to do the will of God on a daily, minute-by-minute basis is the Christian ego death.

This gives a rough outline of my views on the subject. Here is a relevant work by the famous Christian Andrew Murray, "Absolute Surrender."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2TgM2O-5m4I

May the Lord bless you with strength in your inner man, and may He reveal Himself to you with increasing revelation! Praise Him!

I don't know what you mean by "people like me," nor care, but it is not ego. It is my active relationship with the God-person, Jesus Christ through the God-person the Holy Spirit. God is a person. He is not an abstract force or an spiritual concept. He is a person. I'll give you two examples which are relevant to my original posts.

Once while at college, waiting for the last bus of the day to carry me home, I was praying or praising, perhaps talking to the Lord, I can't recall, when suddenly the Lord showed me a vision.

I saw myself, seated upon a throne in a marble throne-room - all that I can recall either in white or black stone, gleaming beautifully. Before me, servants in white robes and servants in black robes continually came to kneel before me, receive a decree, and leave in silent obedience (I was seeing all of this in the third person, I should add - like viewing a scene from a film, almost). These persons were angels. The voice of the Lord spoke to me and said, "Every idle word you say is either giving permission to my holy angels to bring it about, or to Satan and his angels to bring it about." He then brought to my mind a recollection of the story of King David, as he hid in the caves of Judea (I believe). King David, hiding from King Saul at that point, was longing for water from the well of his hometown in Bethlehem, he expressed this out loud, to himself - he thought, but three of his valiant men overheard his longing. Unbeknownst to him, they went to Bethlehem, at the time occupied by some large number of Philistines, and they slew 300 men to bring him a drink of water from that well. The mere passing wish of their King sealed the fates of 300 men that day. The reason this story is relevant, as I pointed out through Romans 6 and Colossians 2-3, is the Christian, raised via the Spirit through faith, is seated with Christ in Heaven spiritually. We are born of a divine birth from above. Our word carries the weight of royalty,

(1/3)

As I said, years later, I was going through a period of spiritual struggle. I felt I kept sinning no matter how hard I tried not to, and my relationship with God was suffering as a result. I felt shame. I cried out to the Lord about this, and one day, I suddenly had a vision.

I saw four fields rapidly flash before my eyes.

The first field was verdant and green, bursting to the brim with vegetation far as the eye could see, yet what grew there were the worst sorts of plants - thorns, thistles, brambles, and everything which would make it impassible, uncontrollable and undesirable.

The second field, which was the same field (all four fields were the same field in differing states), was the same field with the same plants, yet rather than being healthy and green, they were all yellow and dead.

The third field was barren. It had only soil, with little sign of vegetation.

The fourth field was full of every healthy and beautiful thing you could hope for. It looked the way anyone would want a good field to look, and beautifully green.

As soon as the vision passed (it was very quick). The Holy Spirit gave me the interpretation wordlessly. The field is the heart of man - his mind, soul, or whathaveyou. The first, undesirable, state is achieved very simply. As you live your life, there are seeds of sin everywhere. You will encounter them whether you want to or not, generally speaking. Those that water those seeds, by practicing the sins or dwelling on them, water the weeds of the field. In the end, their spiritual state is as tangled and unhealthy as that field.

The second state, the undesirable field of dead plants, comes by actively refusing to practice habitually your sins or to dwell on sin, yet the seeds still fall in the soil, and though unhealthy, over time the plants grow. Something must be done about them.

The third field is what happens when a person obeys the Word, "takes every thought captive," even uprooting sins in their life.

(3/4)

However, when it comes to actually experiencing the death of the ego, which can absolutely occur through spiritual, meditative experiences but is most often achieved through the use of mind altering substances, there is much to be discussed.

Generally, it's almost impossible to describe this experiance or its ramifications with the right words, ego death seems to be at a certain point beyond our understanding though it can be experienced.

I did acid and at the peak of my trip I dipped my toes into the ego death. I wasn't separated from it entirely, but I was on the cusp of it.

To put it simply, I concluded that to experiance ego death is to catch a glimpse as to how God perceives the world. I know, it's very speculative and possibly blasphemous.

You see things, and you sew the connections between them and other things you see. They each have their own stories. A tree, a sign, a cloud rolling across the sky, a droplet of rain, a cow, a kitten, the patchwork of barbed wire fences.

You see and you feel and you understand this great story, every little thing becomes immensely beautiful or ugly, lucky for me I was at a beautiful location as I peaked, it was perfect.

Even while this was going on, concepts in your head meld together (this is a physical process in the brain when one is tripping by the way). The boundaries between EVERYTHING blur. I believe when we die this is what is may be like, and this why those who die experiance a DMT trip, it's to prepare them if at all possible for the 'next level' of consciousness experiance. A spiritual one, lacking a corporeal body. Heavenly existence won't be what it is popularly conceived as being, it's so much more.

(2/2)

The sensitive outer sheathe of their mind has been removed, everything they know as themselves and their thoughts are the product of their bare brain dimly rubbin on everything they encounter.

Their bare brain desnsitizes over time, learning to damp most inputs. They don't reason or think because even of the signals they do get, the noise floor is too high. They can't pick out what is relevant and fall back on mechanical rituals and scripts which work "good enough".

3) Lack of dynamicism, rigidity
They have no sensory sheathe to move around on their brain, so they have equally diminished inner control. They can't control their mind. Like trying to figure out what an object is without fingers.

4) Malleability and cohesion
If nearly everyone is circumcised, the best way to deal with amnplified dominance and submission dynamics caused by constant non-descript and inescapable stimuli, is by submitting to ritual. The brain damaged brain-circumcised have been deeply traumatized (beginning with preverbal trauma to split the core self), this leaves scars and hypersensitive areas. So they come together within, like children playing a game, and learn to create a robotic shell to insulate themselves from the world. They hide in the robot and it protects parts of the inner world.

6) As above, so below.
Maim the body, you shall maim the mind. Maim the mind,it shall be reflected on the body, eventually. Therefore brain circumcision is bidirectional. The brain can be circumcised through the body, or, the whole being can be circumcised through the mind. The foreskin itself need not be touched.
